availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry C. Brennan (Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, captain)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, captain. Kentucky native. Adjutant, 7th Kentucky Infantry in 1862. Mustered in as Captain in the 20th Kentucky Infantry on June 12, 1862 in Nashville, Tennessee. Assistant executive officer at military prison from August 25, 1863 to October 1863. Mustered out on January 17, 1865, in Louisville, Kentucky.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 48, 910.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
